1.text: Iron your leaves between 2 sheets of wax paper to remove the moisture.

2.text: Melt 1 tablespoon (14 g) of wax for each of your leaves in a double boiler.

3.text: Remove the upper pot in your double boiler and set it on a cloth.

4.text: Use a pair of pliers to dunk the leaves in your wax for 1-2 seconds.

5.text: Transfer the leaves to wax paper and let them dry for 3-5 minutes.

6.text: Mix 1 part borax with 2 parts white or yellow cornmeal.

7.text: Coat the bottom of a glass pan or paper box with your borax mixture.

8.text: Add the leaves that you want to preserve to the top of the borax.

9.text: Cover the leaves completely with another layer of borax.

10.text: Let the leaves dry in the borax mixture for 2 weeks.

11.text: Mix a solution of 2 parts warm water and 1 part glycerin.

12.text: Fill a plastic container halfway with the glycerin mixture.

13.text: Cut the stem of your leaves using garden shears or clippers.

14.text: Drop your leaves into the glycerin and press them down a little.

15.text: Cover the leaves and weigh them down if they won’t stay submerged.

16.text: Leave your leaves in the glycerin for at least 24 hours.

17.text: Dry your leaves with paper towels and flatten them for 3-5 days.
